title: What is DISGAEA?
body:
DISGAEA RPG 
The most challenging and fiercest RPG ever, depicting the exploits of various demons, Overlords, angels and humans, all taking place in a place called the "Netherworld".

In this game, players can immerse themselves in the entire DISGAEA series, a world where the 
values of good and evil are reversed, face a range of exciting challenges, and enjoy an entirely new story
starring many classic DISGAEA characters.

Special Thanks
We sincerely thank DJ Moore for his work as Localization Editor and general DISGAEA Expert.

title: Basics
body:
Immerse yourself in the world of DISGAEA, and become kingmaker to the next top Overlord!
A range of unique characters from previous games in the DISGAEA series will join you in your quest as you train up your candidate for the role of strongest Overlord.
There are two types of characters for you to choose from, Humanoid and Monster. 
You can recruit both types via summoning, then put them in your battle party to start training them.

title: Stats
body:
There are 6 Basic Stats for each Character.

·HP: The amount of damage a character can take.
When the HP of the character drops to 0, the character will be eliminated, and cannot rejoin that battle. 

·ATK: A character's ability to deal physical damage. 
A Higher ATK score means the character can deal more
damage when inflicting normal attacks and ATK-oriented skills on enemies.

·DEF: A character's ability to resist physical damage. 
Higher DEF reduces ATK-oriented damage taken by that character.

·INT: Stands for Intelligence. INT is a character's ability to deal magical damage. 
A Higher INT score means the character can deal more damage when inflicting INT-oriented skills on enemies.

·RES: Stands for Resistance. RES is a character's ability to resist magical damage. 
Higher RES reduces INT-oriented damage taken by that character.

·SPD: A character's speed. 
Higher SPD allows the character to act more frequently during battle, and also increases the character's crit rate.

title: ★ Number
body:
★ Number indicates the basic strength of a character.
Any character can reach as high as 6★ via awakening.
And depending on the number of ★, the character's class name will be changed accordingly.

title: Level
body:
Characters stats will increase as they level up.
Characters get new Unique Skills upon reaching certain levels.

title: Max Level
body:
There is a cap on each character's level.
Initially, Max Level is Lv100.
You can "Reincarnate" a character who has reached their Max Level. 
Each Reincarnation adds 100 to that character's Level Cap.

title: Weapon Mastery
body:
Weapon Mastery indicates which types of weapon a character is better at using.
 
Weapon Mastery has its own Current Level and Max Level.

The Max Level of Weapon Mastery can be increased with Mana, which is obtained by Reincarnating characters. 
The Current Level can be increased by using that corresponding type of weapon in battle, or by consuming certain items.

A higher Current WM Level means weapons of that type are more powerful when equipped by a character and used in battle.

Characters get new Weapon Skills upon reaching certain Weapon Mastery Levels.

title: Skills
body:
Up to 4 Skills can be set per Character.
Once set, these Skills can be used in battle.
Weapon skills require the corresponding weapon to be equipped. Weapon skills will be automatically removed if you equip a character with a different type of weapon.

title: Skill Types
body:
There are 3 types of special Skills: 
Unique Skills, Weapon Skills and Spells, which are learned in different ways.
 
 ① Unique Skills 
Learned upon reaching certain Character Levels or after reaching certain Nether Enhancement stages.
 
 ② Weapon Skills 
Learned upon reaching certain Current Weapon Mastery Levels for that corresponding weapon.
 (Staff, Monster Physical and Monster Magic excluded). 
Weapon Skills are only usable 
when the corresponding weapon is equipped.
 
 ③ Spells 
Learned upon certain Current Weapon Mastery Levels 
(only Staff and Monster Magic).

Different Spells are available 
to different characters.

title: Skill Level
body:
Skills have their own levels. 
EXP for Skills is obtained by winning battles with the corresponding moves set or by consuming certain items.
 
Skills with higher levels cost less SP and are more effective.

title: Evility
body:
The passive ability to exert various effects during a battle is called "Evility". 

There are 2 kinds of Evilities: 
Natural Evilities, the default Evilities that a character has from the beginning; and Sub Evilities, the ones a character must learn via Nether Enhance (N.E).

All Evilities possessed by both the party members and their companions will be activated during battle. 

※ If there are multiple Evilities that change normal attacks according to certain party stats, they will be activated in sequence based on party setup. 
(The Evility of the rightmost character in the party will be activated first.) 
※ For Evilities that allow the user to take damage for (shelter) other party members, they will not be activated in cases where absorbing the damage would kill the user.

title: Cheat Rank
body:
Cheat Rank increases the basic stats of a character.
It's applicable for each stat respectively. 
You get Mana by Reincarnating in Mao's Lab, then apply it in "Ability Cheat" to increase your Cheat Rank.

title: Mana
body:
You get Mana by Reincarnating Characters.
In Mao's Lab, the Mana you get can be allocated via "Allocate Mana" to grant a character "Ability Cheats" (to increase certain Stats) or increase their WM Level Cap. 
You can spend Mana however you like 
to make your characters stronger.

title: Resistance
body:
Resistance reduces damage taken by the 4 elements of each skill in battle.
0 is the baseline. 
A positive number means the character is resistant to an element. 
The higher the number, the less damage taken from an element.
A negative number means the character is vulnerable to an element. 
The lower the number, the more damage taken from an element.

title: Weapon Forte
body: Each Character has one Weapon Forte, which means a higher starting WM Level Cap for this type of weapon than for the others.

title: Basics
body:
Just like characters, equipment also has stats that can be raised and then added to a character while it's equipped.

There are 2 types of equipment: Weapons and Armor. 
Aside from purchasing items from the Shop, they can also be obtained in the Item World or earned as various kinds of rewards.

There are a few factors that affect the strength of equipment: 
Level, Rarity, Rank and Innocents.

You can check the rank of a piece of equipment upon purchase or via the Item World. 
The higher the rank, the better the equipment.

title: Equipment Rarity
body:
Equipment Rarity ranges from 0-100. 
Higher Rarity means more Inhabiting Innocents and higher POP.

According to the Rarity, Equipment is divided into 3 Grades as follows: 

<COMMON>
Rarity 0-39

<RARE>
Rarity 40-69

<LEGEND>
Rarity 70-100

title: Equipment Level
body:
Boosting its Equipment Level can further increase the stats of a piece of Equipment.
Equipment Level can be increased by challenging the Item World.

The Max Level of a piece of Equipment depends on its Grade. 

<COMMON>
Max Level: 50

<RARE>
Max Level: 100

<LEGEND>
Max Level: 180

title: Innocents
body:
The inhabitants of Equipment are called Innocents. 
Innocents have effects called 'XX Boost' (Amplifier/Enhancer), and will take effect after you subdue them in the Item World. 

HP Boost, ATK Boost, INT Boost, DEF Boost, RES Boost, SPD Boost, HP Amplifier, ATK Amplifier, DEF Amplifier, INT Amplifier, RES Amplifier → 
Will affect the stats of the Equipment the Innocent lives in. 

EXP Boost, HL Boost, WM Enhancer, Skill Enhancer → 
Will affect the combat ability of the character wearing the equipment that an Innocent lives in. 

There are also special Innocents that 
can only be obtained during events or other methods.

title: Innocent Rarity
body:
There are 3 Rarities for Innocents. 
COMMON < RARE < LEGEND 
The rarer the Innocent is, the better it will be.

title: POP (Max Innocent Number)
body:
The POP number of equipment shows how many Innocents can inhabit that equipment.
They are shown in the following format with the current number of Innocent inhabitants.

 <EXAMPLE>
POP 6/10
(Current Number/Max Number)

title: Innocent Transfer
body:
Innocents subdued in the Item World can be removed and applied in "Innocent Transfer".
It's free to remove an Innocent for the first time, but it costs HL to do so again in the future.
The higher the Rarity of the Innocent, the higher the cost to remove them.

title: Basics
body:
It's turn-based manual combat with a team of up to 5 members.
You win the battle by defeating all enemy waves, and lose the battle if 
all your members are defeated.

Combatants, friendly or enemy alike, act one by one according to the order shown in the 
Action Gauge.

title: SP
body:
SP are the points required for characters to use their Skills in battle.
The SP cost differs for each Skill.

title: Skills
body:
Up to 4 Skills can be set per character.
It costs SP to use Skills in battle.

The effects of Skills vary, and include dealing damage, recovering HP, and bestowing Status Ailments (as follows). 

<Poison>
Take damage equal to 10% of max HP at the beginning of the turn for a number of turns.
Poison will NOT finish a character off, it will only reduce the character's HP to 1.
 
<Sleep>
Renders a character inactive for a number of turns. 
The effect is lifted once the character is attacked.
The character cannot be controlled even on their own turn.
 
<Paralysis>
Renders a character inactive for a number of turns. 
The character cannot be controlled even on their own turn.

<Forget>
Renders a character unable to use Skills for a number of turns.

title: Killing EXP
body: Delivering the killing blow grants a Kill Bonus, which provides more EXP than usual.

title: Lifting
body:
"Lifting" is when one of your characters lifts another in order to perform a Tower Attack.
The lifting character cannot use Skills. 
Only "Throw" or "Tower Attack" can be used. 
The effect will get stronger based on the number and strength of characters lifted.
You can deal damage to enemies with "Throwing", but doing so will cancel your tower status.
 
Characters being lifted cannot attack or be attacked.
SP and Killing EXP are granted for Throws and Tower Attacks.
 
<Throwing a Prinny>
When you Lift and Throw a "Prinny", you deal massive damage to all enemies. 
But the Prinny you throw will also be knocked out of battle due to having exploded.

title: Battle Settings
body:
< AUTO (Automatic Combat)> 
You can turn on automatic combat by toggling AUTO to ON. 

<x1/x2/x4 (Speedup Function)> can be used to change the speed of battles. 

You can also change Power-saving, Volume and other settings  in Menu, and quit a battle by tapping Give Up. 

The game will consume less power when Power-saving is toggled ON. 
※ Game UI will switch to Power-saving mode as well. 

When VOICE and other speedup settings are toggled ON, the speed of voices can be fixed at 1x even if the speed of battle is faster. 

When skip skill effect is toggled ON, animations of skills that you've already seen will be skipped. 
This doesn't apply to animations that are played for the first time.

title: Basics
body:
You can get new characters by summoning with "Nether Quartz" or "Tickets".
Please check the summon details for the list of characters available and their drop rates.

title: Basics
body:
After becoming friends with other players, you can send them Sardines (AP) once per day.
When selecting Companions, your friends' characters will be shown at the top. 
To become friends, you need to send a friend request and be approved.

title: Friend Application
body:
You can send Applications in Friend Search, or to the owner of your Companion after a battle. 

If the target player's approval is set to "Anyone", then any application will be automatically approved.

If the target player's approval is set to "Approval Needed", then the player has to approve or reject the application in "Friends - Pending".

You can change your own settings via 
"MENU - Settings".

title: Sending Sardines
body:
You can send Sardines to your friends once per day.
This limit is restored at the daily reset time every day.

AP will be partially restored after receiving Sardines from friends.

title: Party
body:
You can set up the members of your party. 

If a party member's Evilities and Sub Evilities can be applied to the whole party, their effects will be shown on all party members. 

You can slide left and right to switch between parties. 
You can rename a party by tapping the icon on the right of the party's name.

title: Character List
body:
A list to show all the characters you own. 

You can tap on a character to check details. 

You can tap the Demote button on the top left to access the Demote (Sell) Screen.

title: Equipment List
body:
A list to show all the equipment you own. 

You can tap on a piece of equipment to check details. 
You can Transfer Innocents via Details.

title: Innocent List
body:
A list to show all the Innocents you own. 

Unsubdued Innocents will appear as a question mark. 

Innocents that have been transferred to other equipment after being subdued will be locked and require HL to unlock. 

You can demote Innocents and get HL by using "Innocent Demotion" in the warehouse.

title: Basics
body:
Battle (Dimension Gate) is the entrance to all battles.
 
 You can access gameplay such as the Main Story and Netherworld History by tapping Battle (Dimension Gate).

title: Basics
body:
DISGAEA RPG's original story mode. 

There are two parts to it: 
Story and Quests. 
It costs AP to battle in Quests.

title: Difficulties
body:
The Main Story has 3 difficulties: 
EASY-NORMAL-HARD.

Clearing EP 1 EASY unlocks 
EP 1 NORMAL. 

Clearing EP 7 EASY unlocks 
EP 1 HARD.

title: Companions
body:
One Companion unit can be selected before every battle.

The Companion can be swapped in at any time during your turn. 

The Evility and Sub Evilities of the Companion are in full effect from the start of battle.

The Companions and their stats available are limited to certain characters and thresholds in certain Quests.

title: Quest Missions
body:
Each Quest has 3 special Missions. 

You'll get a one-time reward by completing all the missions.

title: Basics
body:
Netherworld History allows players to enjoy the past stories of the DISGAEA series in short form.

There are two parts to it: 
Story and Quests. 
It costs AP to battle in Quests.

title: Basics
body:
There are 4 gates in Dark Gates: 
The Gate of EXP, The Gate of HL, The Gate of Gems (Humanoid) and 
The Gate of Gems (Monster).

You can challenge these gates a certain number of times each day. 
Challenge attempts are restored at the daily reset time.

You can challenge them beyond that limit with Gate Key.

What's more, you can skip battles with DG Skip Coupons after clearing all Quest Missions.

title: Basics
body:
The Item World comprises special quests that exist in Equipment. 

Equipment will become stronger after each level of its Item World is cleared. 

You can further enhance your equipment by subduing the Innocents you encounter in the Item World. 

<Auto Advancing>
In Item World battles, you can automatically "Advance to the Next Level" via the battle results screen if you enable the button on the top left.

title: Item World Levels
body:
The number of levels in the Item World vary depending on the Rarity of Equipment. 

<COMMON>
30 Levels
<RARE>
60 Levels 
<LEGEND>
100 Levels

title: Subduing Innocents
body:
You'll encounter Innocents inhabiting the Item World. 

The following options become available 
when you encounter an Innocent. 
<Bribe>
<Subdue>

<Bribe>
Bribing an Innocent increases its affinity.
With higher affinity, you're more likely to succeed when you try to subdue it.

 <Subdue> 
is asking an Innocent to submit.
You're more likely to succeed with a higher affinity. 

After successfully subduing an Innocent, its effect will be applied to the equipment.
You can transfer Innocents to other equipment.

If you fail to subdue an Innocent, it may take the following actions. 
Escape - Affinity UP. 
Escaped Innocents will disappear and no longer exist in the equipment. 
As for Affinity UP, you can ask it to submit again with the "subdue" option.

title: Bosses
body:
The following Bosses will appear on certain levels of the Item World. 

 <Item General>
Appears every 10 Levels Increases the Lv of the Equipment by 5-6 after being defeated
<Item King>
Appears every 30 Levels Increases the Lv of the Equipment by 11 after being defeated
<Item God>
Appears every 100 Levels Increases the Lv of the Equipment by 21 after being defeated
※ When multiple appearance conditions overlap, the stronger boss will appear.

In addition, after defeating the boss, you have a chance to get equipment 1 rank higher than your current equipment.

title: Basics
body:
Available after clearing the Main Story EP 7 EASY.

Your aim is to advance in the Overlord's Tower to the top level.

More levels are added periodically. 
※ All rewards are one-off rewards, only issued when clearing a level for the first time. 

No Companions are allowed in the Overlord's Tower.

title: Daily Missions
body:
In Daily Missions, you can claim rewards once you complete the objectives every day. 

Daily Missions are refreshed at the daily reset time, after which you can no longer claim rewards for the previous day.

title: Milestones
body:
In Milestones, you can claim the reward once you complete the objective.

There are 3 Difficulties of Missions: 
<Bronze> <Silver> and <Gold>
. The number of completions will be recorded for each difficulty.

title: Basics
body:
You can purchase various Items, Equipment and Nether Quartz in the Shop (RQ Shop).

You can also sell equipment, expand slots for characters and equipment, and participate in lotteries here.

title: Customer Rank
body:
Better equipment becomes available with higher Customer Ranks.

You can increase your Customer Rank by passing bills in the Dark Assembly. 

Bills that increase your Customer Rank will be unlocked at certain points in the Main Story.

title: Purchasing Nether Quartz
body: You can purchase Nether Quartz and Special Offer Packs.

title: Purchasing Items
body:
You can purchase AP Potions and "Bribe" Items 
with Nether Quartz and HL.

title: Purchasing Equipment
body:
You can purchase equipment based on your Customer Rank. 

You can refresh the current merchandise list for free 5 times a day. 
Extra refreshes cost Nether Quartz.
Free refreshes are restored at the daily reset time. 

In addition, you can refresh the list with a lower Customer Rank than your current one. 

The shop will automatically refresh based on your current Customer Rank at daily reset time every day.

title: Selling Equipment
body:
You can sell any equipment you own. 

Equipped equipment will not be shown in the list of sellable items. 
You should note that all Innocents in the equipment will disappear when you sell it.

title: Expanding Slots
body: You can expand slots for your characters and equipment with Nether Quartz.

title: Lottery
body:
After purchasing a certain amount of equipment and items in the shop, you can get 1 Lucky Ball Lottery Ticket once a day. 

You can use that ticket to participate in the Lucky Ball Lottery. 

You'll win random prizes in the Lucky Ball Lottery. 
You should note that the number of purchase to get the ticket resets the next day.

title: Basics
body:
You can claim rewards based on your injuries, as well as use the Doping Roulette to restore some 
AP.

title: Rewards
body:
<Total Damage Taken>
<Total Members Defeated>
<Total Party Wipeouts>
Rewards will be issued after the above conditions are met.

※ Rewards for <Total Damage Taken> 
are not affected by defeats.

title: Doping Roulette
body:
It's a Roulette that restores AP. 

You have to wait for a while between uses.

title: Basics
body: You can pass bills in the Dark Assembly in order to improve your game experience, including increasing your Customer Rank at the RQ Shop.

title: Assembly Point
body:
These are the Pts needed to propose bills in the Dark Assembly. 
Costs vary depending on the bills proposed. 

Pts reset to 100 at 00:00 each day. 
You can also manually reset them to 100 using Nether Quartz.

title: The Probability of Bill
body:
The Likeliness of Passing depends on the bill itself. 
The Likeliness for certain bills increases as the player levels up. 

It's essential to "Bribe" the senators to get their affinity for a higher chance to pass your bill.

title: Bribing
body:
You can "Bribe" the senators to earn their affinity. 

With a higher affinity, there's a better chance for the senator to support your bill, thus increasing the likeliness of your bill getting passed.

If you need to raise your affinity with multiple senators, you'll need to bribe them all.

title: Senators
body:
In the Dark Assembly, 8 Senators are required to vote on each bill. 

Senators have their ★ numbers and levels as well. 
Stronger Senators have a bigger say, thus could influence the result more than others.

title: Basics
body: You can enhance your characters in Mao's Lab via Reincarnation, Awakening, N.E., Mana Allocation, etc.

title: Basics
body:
In "N.E.", you can improve your characters by learning new Skills and Sub Evilities, and by increasing character stats.

You can consume an identical character as material to Nether Enhance the one you want to improve. 
It costs HL to N.E. characters. 

By using a character that has already undergone N.E. as material, its number of N.E. will be passed on to the one you are currently Nether Enhancing. 
In that case, the amount of HL needed for the N.E. will be increased accordingly. 

However, characters that have been Enhanced more than 10 times cannot be used as material. 

<Example> 
When using a character that has been Enhanced once as material to N.E. a character with 0 N.E., the number of N.E. will become 2. 
The cost of HL will be that of the 2nd N.E. 

An N.E. Prinny can be used as material to Enhance any character. 
And Prism Hide, with enough amount, will work as a universal material as well.

title: N.E. Items
body:
There can be up to 10 N.E.s for a character. 

You unlock 1 new item from top to bottom 
each time you N.E.

title: Basics
body:
You can improve a character by getting more ★ in character Awakening. 

You can consume 5 characters 
of the same ★ as material to Awaken the one you want to improve. 
It costs HL to Awaken characters. 

You can awaken 1★ and 2★ characters in bulk by using "Awaken All". 
In this case, the character you are training cannot be selected as material. 
In addition, weapons and armor equipped by the material character will be unequipped.

title: Basics
body:
In a Reincarnation, choose the character which you'd like to upgrade to the highest level. 
Reincarnation will reset the character to level "1" and 

- cap up the character's Max Level
- increase the character's basic stats
- enable the character to level up faster 
- get mana from reincarnation With these, you can further enhance the character.
It also costs HL.

title: Reincarnation Materials
body:
The necessary materials for the Reincarnation differ according to the target (Humanoid/Monster), and the number of reincarnation times. 

Materials are mainly obtained from the Dark Gates.

title: Basics
body:
Mana Allocation refers to using the Mana you get from Reincarnation on "Ability Enhancement" and "WM Level Cap Up" etc to further improve the character. 

You can also increase the Mana for a character by using "Mana Potion".

title: Ability Cheat
body:
Ability Cheat refers to increasing the "Cheat Rank" of a character with Mana, thus enhancing character stats. 

Each stat can be enhanced with "Ability Cheat" up to 20 times.

title: Increasing Max Weapon Mastery Lv
body: You can use Mana to increase Max Weapon Mastery Lv.

title: Resetting Mana Allocation
body:
You can reset the Mana you allocated on ability enhancement. 

After resetting, previously enhanced stats will be returned to their unimproved state. 

However, Mana invested on Max Weapon Mastery Lv cannot be reset. 

You can reset Mana Allocation for free a certain number of times, after that it will cost Nether Quartz to do so again.

title: Basics
body:
You can replay all Stories you've gone through, including Main Story and Events in the Memory Shop. 

You can even watch Character EPs once certain conditions have been met.

title: Character Episodes
body:
When certain characters reach certain levels, you can watch their unique stories. 

You will get rewards after watching these stories.

title: Basics
body:
You can check various info 
in the Data Shop. 

 <Character Illustration>
You can check the info of 
all characters you have.

 <Equipment Illustration>
You can check the info of 
all equipment you have.

 <History Record>
You can check the latest gameplay records, including: days played, highest damage dealt, rank and other data.

title: Basics
body:
You can customize the background and BGM of your stronghold.

· The BGM and Background of the stronghold 
can be changed at will. 

You can get new BGM and Backgrounds via Dark Assembly and other means. 

In order for the corresponding bill to become available, you need to reach a certain point in the main story.

title: Basics
body:
Tap on MENU on the top right then "Transfer", and you'll get the "Transfer Code" needed.

Please take good care of your "Player ID" and "Transfer Code". 

After downloading and installing the game on a new device, go to "Transfer" in MENU and input your "Player ID" and "Transfer Code", then you can continue playing on the new device. 

WARNING: Transferring between devices of different OS will result in your paid Nether Quartz turning into 
free Nether Quartz of the same number.

title: Basics
body:
You can fix certain unexpected glitches to improve your game experience through "Clear Cache".

All you need to do is tap MENU at the top right, then tap "Clear Cache".

title: Basics
body:
With Data Repair, you can delete generated data and keep operations running smoothly.
Your saved game progress will not be deleted. 

You can do this by tapping MENU at the top right, and then tapping "Data Repair".

title: Basics
body:
You can tap MENU at the top right, then tap "Settings" to change the following settings: 
Power-saving, Volume, Notification, Friend Approval etc.

The game will consume less power when Power-saving is turned ON. 
※ The game UI will enter Power-saving mode as well.

Please note: 
if you have disabled notifications on your device, you won't receive notifications even if you enable them here in the game.
